title.rendered: Reasons Why Your Current Air Duct Installer May Not Be Hitting The Mark

content.rendered:
Every time you turn on the air conditioning or heating system, the air is supposed to flow in through the supply ducts and out through return ducts. These ducts running through your home are a crucial component of your HVAC system.

But you will be surprised to find out how many ductwork and HVAC systems are incorrectly installed.

According to Energy Star data, more than 50% of new HVAC systems in the United States don’t perform up to their efficiency due to inadequate installation.

When installed improperly, HVAC and air duct installations can not only ruin the indoor air quality but also cause high energy bills.

In this post, we are going to share some signs that mean your current air duct installation, DFW, is not up to the mark.

5 Signs That Your Currently Installed Air Ducts DFW Need To Be Changed

Air Duct Leaks

Nearly 20% of the air that travels through the duct system is lost due to cracks, leaks, and improperly connected ductwork. Any leaks in the ducts can cause the HVAC system to work harder than it should.

If the ducts aren’t tight enough, they will not only lose conditioned air but the negative air pressure will also suck in dirty air. This situation can be especially problematic in attics, garages, crawlspaces, and basements.

Check for any gaps, cracks, and poor connections around the seams of all your air ducts. If you suspect any leaks, call professionals for air duct installation DFW services. 

Also, if you or someone in your family is suffering from allergies or breathing issues associated with an increased amount of dust, it may be another sign of leaks in the ductwork. These leaks allow all sorts of debris, dust, and unfiltered air in, compromising the indoor air quality.

Here are some common signs of leaky air ducts:

  •       Rooms feel stuffy and uncomfortable to breathe in
  •       Rooms are difficult to cool or heat
  •       Higher than usual energy bills

If you notice any of the above signs, schedule air ducts DFW testing with another competent HVAC company immediately.

Cold and Hot Spots

If you are consistently experiencing cold and hot spots around your house, it may be due to wrong size ductwork or problems with the airflow.

Undersized grilles and ducts restrict airflow and may be causing the temperature issues. If you notice strange noises (like popping or whistling) and loud airflow, it is most likely due to blocked vents or improperly sized ducts.

If you spot any drooping flex ducts, contact a professional air duct installation DFW company so they can check all your ductwork is pulled tight and well-supported.

Call the Leading Air Ducts DFW Maintenance, Repair, and Installation Company in DFW

If you are experiencing airflow or temperature problems, it might be because your original HVAC installer didn’t do a good job. It’s time to call in some backup! 

At United Home Services, we can help you troubleshoot and fix any ductwork problems you may have. Our expert technicians make sure that all duct fittings are pre-insulated and only rigid metal is used for the fittings. Call us toll-free at 800-399-4248 or reach us online today!
